We show that text-structuring can be formulated as a Constraint Satisfaction Problem, so that all solutions rest)ecting constraints on text-structure formation and structu,'al compatibility can be efficiently generated. Of the many sohltions generated by this method, some are stylistically preferable to others; we show how further constraints can be applied in order to select the best versions.
